item.title: Looking into the gender balance
item.author: Matthew Proctor,Eoghan Totten,
item.description: Male undergraduates continue to outnumber females by nearly two to one as revealed by the College Strategic Planning Division. Felix tries to make sense of it all. The (unsurprising) revelation came to light after the department revealed that for the previous academic year a mere …

item.title: Our workload woes
item.author: Matthew Proctor,
item.description: As students of Imperial College, we often regard ourselves as some of the hardest worked students in the country. A quick Google search reveals many students’ reviews of their time at Imperial. One such review on a website called WhatUni.com, which offers advice to those applying to University, from …

item.title: AMS Album of the Week 5
item.author: Matthew Proctor,
item.description: Crystal Castles’ rise to fame has undoubtedly been rapid. From their debut album (I) in 2008 to their latest release (III), the band has attracted a huge fan base. They went from playing in dingy, underground bars to playing Reading this year. With this rise, the band has matured. Their new album …

item.title: Imperial has highest international fees
item.author: Matthew Proctor,Aemun Reza,
item.description: Imperial College has been found to charge the most for their International student tuition fees out of the Russell group universities. The data shows that Imperial’s international students who do clinical medicine are charged a massive £39,150. International fees are broken down into bands. Band 1 …
